title: EPISTOLA Robert R. Knepper
html:
EPISTOLA Robert R. Knepper

A correction to “Baby-San's Lingo,” by D. Gordon and R. L. Spear (XXV/3 Summer 2000). The newspaper in which Hume's cartoons appeared was not Stars & Stripes (Pacific edition). It was Pacific Stars & Stripes, a separate publication, not an appendage of the European paper. I served on Pac S&S in 1953/54 and belong to the Stars & Stripes Assn. made up of alumni and current staffers of both papers, as well as those who served on the Midpacifican, precursor to Pac S&S.

[Robert R. Knepper, Lakewood, California]
